function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Historically, pandemics have always had an impact on architecture.","Impact":"Changes in architectural design influenced by infectious diseases.","Mitigation":"Use of advanced technologies and knowledge to create resilient and adaptive architectural designs.","Technologies":"Advanced material science, modular construction, and building automation.","People":"Architects, urban planners, building designers.","Owner":"Architectural firms, construction companies, and government agencies."},{"Description":"Human fear of infectious diseases has led to the emergence of artificial environments.","Impact":"Creation of artificial environments for protection against infectious diseases.","Mitigation":"Integration of natural and sustainable design principles to create healthier living environments.","Technologies":"Biophilic design, natural ventilation systems, and green building materials.","People":"Building designers, environmental engineers, public health officials.","Owner":"Architectural firms, environmental engineering firms, and health organizations."},{"Description":"Limited technology, knowledge, and resources make historical solutions to pandemics not applicable worldwide.","Impact":"Inability to implement historical solutions to pandemics globally.","Mitigation":"Investment in research and development of globally applicable solutions, knowledge sharing, and capacity building in resource-constrained regions.","Technologies":"Telemedicine, remote diagnostics, and global knowledge sharing platforms.","People":"Global health organizations, research institutions, policymakers.","Owner":"International health organizations, philanthropic foundations, and government agencies."}]}
